node.title: Former cricketer Michael Slater arrested for allegedly breaching an AVO
node.alt: A man wearing a hat and jacket
node.description: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater is refused bail after allegedly breaching an apprehended violence order two months after being charged with stalking and harassment offences over an alleged domestic violence incident.
node.content: ["Former Australian Test cricketer Michael Slater has been arrested after allegedly breaching an apprehended violence order (AVO).\u00a0", "In October, the former batsman\u00a0was charged with stalking and harassment offences over an alleged domestic violence incident.\u00a0", "NSW Police arrested Slater earlier today, after which he was refused police bail.", "He is set to appear in Manly Local Court today.", "Slater, 51, was arrested in Manly in October and charged with a stalking offence, as well as using a carriage service to harass.", "Since ending on his playing career, Slater had been a high-profile television commentator both in Australia and overseas.", "However, earlier this month Channel 7 did not renew his contract, citing financial pressures.", "In May, Slater attacked Prime Minister Scott Morrison in a series of social media posts that made headlines.", "Slater took to Twitter to claim the PM had \"blood on his hands\", and complained the Commonwealth should be doing more to help Australians stranded in COVID-ravaged India."]
